Reviews.Author: Alvaro Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone and we have never been able to make it work properly, it's frustrating that they sale the product with such low quality. If you are thinking on buying this model, I highly recommend you to think it over and reconsider to buy another model because in my case was literally a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: stay away
Reviews.Author: penname
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone trying to get a cheap option for a good phone to put on straighttalk. It worked great for about two months. After that the phone refused to turn on or even charge. Just stay away. I read of a breakout of these phone just randomly breaking. and since I dont have insurence for it I cant get it replaced.

Reviews.Title: Not what I thought I would get...
Reviews.Author: Alexander Axelsson
Reviews.Content: Purchased this phone unlocked thinking that I would get a brand new phone from Samsung. Turns out I got a used phone from Orange (a French provider). It even had some apps installed from the previous person owning it.Condition said: New but got used.This is unacceptable business practice. I will NOT use this seller again and I would not recommend anyone using it either.The Phone itself works for my intents and purposes but nobody likes being sold "used" when the buyer expects to get new.

Reviews.Title: BAD BAD BAD BAD BAD PRODUCT.
Reviews.Author: Tulio Bordones
Reviews.Content: The phone arrived in good condition. The phone lit perfect, but the phone is finished charging, and lit no more. Send to review the phone and no repair. I am very disappointed, I rate it as a bad product. I lost my dollars and shipping charges.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME PHONE!
Reviews.Author: Jesler G. Garcia Rojas "jesler"
Reviews.Content: This is the best phone I have ever owned. It is very fast and responsive. Easy to use and set-up. I loved the S2 but this is even better. Before I bought it I was debating whether to get this s3 or the iPhones but after comparing my phone with my friends iPhones, this was defiantly the best choice. I think all the features are great, but my favourite is the camera. It is 8MP but some of the settings and options make the camera brilliant, some of the photos I have taken are better than photos I have seen on professional cameras.The screen is excellent and is the clearest screen I have ever seen. The first thing I did when I got the phone was play the sample movie, it shows how clear and detailed the screen is. Videos in High Definition are very clear !!. The sound is very clear too. I like games, so i'll comment on that. The performance for games is amazing. I downloaded 'ShadowGun' Which is free for the S3 from the Samsung app store. The revised version makes use of the quad core processor in the phone. The visuals are details, smooth and hardly any jagged edges. It performs with a solid frame rate; and I've never experienced slowdown on any games. The graphics are powerful enough to emulate play-station games.Other notable features are the sensors in the phone which do more things than I've actually used yet. This phone, granted, is expensive. But it is so worth it. This phone is so good, it's better than a phone people have to hack to do things with.Pros: Lightweight, technologically fantastic, excellent features, long battery, well designed.

Reviews.Title: Just Right
Reviews.Author: Chris Reynolds
Reviews.Content: I wanted a phone size, android to slip in my pocket.I use T-Mobile pay as you go unless I travel and then switch to $3/day plan.  The Phone works well with T-Mobile.I  get about 2-days out of the battery without turning off GPS WiFi etc.

Reviews.Title: Good --but no service available
Reviews.Author: R. Keene "tapper"
Reviews.Content: Had the phone and loved it for 3 days until it locked up on me with a message about an Emergenmcy call and left a cursor and space to input a number which I have no idea what it is about.  Called Samsung in Texas and that is the only service center in the US.  They said I would have to call the country of origin--the UK--for service because it is an international phone.  Very disgusting---I have a $400.00 phone I can't unlock and can't use.  It is such a new phone noone knows how to fix it except someone in the UK.

Reviews.Title: bad
Reviews.Author: buddie milstead
Reviews.Content: had phone less then 40 days ,now does not charge ,tried to return, they would not let me paid 187.00

Because of the distance, I went to a samsung authorized costumer service here in Venezuela, and they allowed me to see how this piece of crap wasn't a new one and assembled with used parts with very low quality welding points and poor finishing. DO NOT BUY FROM Lucky Buy Retailers

Reviews.Author: wishlist owner
Reviews.Content: i just want to say that this is the third cellphone i bought through Amazon and comes defective. After a month of using it stop working right, it suddenly turn off and now it don't receive right the charge. In addition to that, i noticed that the headphone aren't original, they are a generic ones and the case of the cellphone don't fit right. All this thing just tell me that the cellphone it is not a Samsung original as they claim, and as i say is the third time it happens to me.

Reviews.Title: The device was defective
Reviews.Author: Waldir Pimenta
Reviews.Content: The device I got was defective. It seemed to work well at first, but then it started crashing randomly. I tried to contact the seller (OneStopBuyMart) but they never responded, and the nearest Samsung support center refused to take the item for repairing, saying it was fake. So, while the real deal is probably excellent, judging by other reviewers, the device had the chance to test out was pure garbage.

Reviews.Content: good afternoonI am from Venezuela, I acquired a customizable phone Samsung Galaxy S3 GT-i8190 mini serial: R21F10FB51R IMEI: 351526063542483, his shop through amazon.com, according to the publication I was saying that it was released for a band, but when putting on my simcard calls me a pin code or with any network operator here in Venezuela to unlock the phone, it shows me that it is not released, so I still like to know how they could help me resolve this situation as I need the phone and still no e could use it.thank you very much your prompt response and thanking goodbyeSandra Angel

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy
Reviews.Author: HENRY M.
Reviews.Content: Wonderful product.... just what I needed. Very good price for that quality. I will be getting another one soon. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Joel Alejandro Rial Da Silva
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, 100% original. It's my first Android and I'm very happy, shame that the manufacturer shall not draw more OS updates. Thank you, greetings.

Reviews.Title: Defective item and non refundable once you open the package, but i don't see any other way to find out if its working fine.
Reviews.Author: neelu
Reviews.Content: i brought this item for $197.** just because it said it had 1 year limited warranty at the time,now they r saying it was packed and sent by amazon, and amazon people say they can give only 80% of my money back.i opened it the first month to see if it will work on gsm, it worked fine.then i went India and checked if it was international unlocked version, it worked fine until 5-6 days, then came back to US and its been only 7 days it started showing glitches. the screen goes off when i try to touch to select an operation, or screen goes dark and bright stripes while browsing..also the device never connects to wifi, keep on searching for hours.i cant hear voice clearly while on call, lot of glitches and problems with the device  now if i want to return it i will get 80% refund, after all the mail charges i will get only 50% of my money back.i tried to save $50 by buying here and lost $100 and brought a crap.

Reviews.Title: Good For Three Months
Reviews.Author: Braden Jageman
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone three months ago and it was working great until all of a sudden it instantly died and is completely unresponsive to turning on. Turns out these phones are built with cheap materials and this is a pretty common issue.If you need a phone for three months I would highly recommended it. Otherwise I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: I am not very pleased
Reviews.Author: Trini Rissy
Reviews.Content: The phone has various manufacture defects. The first problem is that the phone gives a feedback. Anyone who calls me hears an echo when they speak. The second problem is that it occasionally malfunctions. You would see applications being opened and closed on its own and the only way to stop it is to switch the phone off and on again. I would not recommend the S3 Mini to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Fun little phone
Reviews.Author: G. Ramirez "gr23latin"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my fiancee, and the phone at first it was great. Now after a few months, it starting to have problems, she tells me that it freezes a lot, it becomes non-respondent. I try to find out what was wrong with it, and found out that Samsung has had many problems with this model. In many of the cases it need it replacement. I guess, for what I payed, it was too good to be true.

Reviews.Title: SOSVENEZUELA
Reviews.Author: Mau / Valencia / Vzla
Reviews.Content: THAT WAS ALL WE CAN AFFORD TO PURCHASE. JUST US$300 A YEAR. SOSVENEZUELA  IT IS JUST A MATTER OF TIME. WE WILL BE FREE PRETTY SOON. THE WORLD WILL TELL

Reviews.Title: the product is not unlocked
Reviews.Author: Jonis
Reviews.Content: I am not satisfied with the product. The phone is not unlocked.Product specifications indicates that this unlocked. receive the product is not unlocked, not the product meets my expectations. bad ServiceJonís

Reviews.Title: good treat
Reviews.Author: edgar
Reviews.Content: it came good. this product it bring to. venezuela. just in case sos vnzla. sos vnzla. sos vzla. sos ven

Reviews.Title: Very good phone.
Reviews.Author: Pablo Ignacio Reyes Isaacura "Pablo Reyes"
Reviews.Content: It has the perfect size for me. I wasn't looking for something too big. It's as fast as I require. And maybe, one of its best characteristics, it has a very good look.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: marcilio
Reviews.Content: works excellent in Venezuela, recommend, everything perfect up H +, it is very comfortable, has the right size, very good

Reviews.Title: False advertising - I received a locked phone
Reviews.Author: Deborah
Reviews.Content: I am extremely disappointed with this seller.  I ordered this phone as a birthday treat to myself because I really liked the phone and loved the idea that it was unlocked. When I received it, I took out my SIM card from my old phone and put it in to my supposedly newly unlocked phone, only to discover that the phone did not recognize the SIM card!! I thought maybe I was not doing something right. So, I took the phone in to our telephone service provider who told me, "sorry ma'am, but this phone is locked". I ask the technician if he was sure and he said yes, positive.  I noticed that the phone also had Telcel which I know is a telephone service provider in Mexico.  I didn't really care about that, I just wanted the phone to be unlocked.  It is useless to me right now and so I am returning this phone. I will never buy from Mobile Best Seller.  I do regret not checking out the seller rating because I was just too excited to get the phone.Not a happy customer

Reviews.Title: Came with network lock for Telcel
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Garcia Davila "Kastar lurax"
Reviews.Content: The phone is great, but it came with a network lock for Telcel. I have had to work around unlocking it myself. It says factory unlocked international version. Makes me think you are getting phones from a Mexican Telcel company and selling them as factory unlocked. You should advise your users about this. Or at least lower the cost.

Reviews.Title: first impression: great phone!
Reviews.Author: A. Macdonald Jr.
Reviews.Content: I got this phone two days ago after a huge snowstorm. I really didn't expect UPS to be delivering stuff that day, but they did.I got this phone to replace a Nokia c6-01.  The first thing I noticed was that it is about half the weight of my old phone and the screen is much bigger. It is also twice as thin. I put my sim card in and my memory card. All the photos and videos I took with my Nokia were there, along with all my music files.  Since installing my memory card, I have realized that I have too many photos. Most of them I have already transferred to my computer.I don't need to preserve them on my phone. I am going to reformat my memory card.I set this phone up so I could send and receive text messages as well as email. I also like the voice activated google search. Also, I don't have to use a keyboard every time I want to send a message. I just speak the message. Speech recognition on this phone is great.I realize this is an unlocked phone originally meant to be sold in Europe, but the charger I got with this cannot be used in the USA.  I don't see why I didn't get at least an adapter or a travel charger designed to be used in my country. I noticed that other reviewers got one of these with their phones. I guess it depends who you get them from. Also, I think it would be helpful if Amazon corrected the grossly misspelled word in the description of this phone ( verison should be VERSION).UPDATE #1:I have had this for a week now. I forgot that I had dimmed the screen to save battery power.  It was fine when I wanted to read what was on the screen in my house, but yesterday I had to use the phone in bright sunlight.Increasing the screen brightness did the trick.Also I learned that to send an MMS message, I had to connect to mobile data. The MMS message incurred no data charge, but I still had to connect to mobile data. Strange.

Reviews.Title: are responsible not meet what they offer
Reviews.Author: German Ramirez
Reviews.Content: good night, these people are few inresponsables offering unlocked cell phones and that does so should not continue to punish working with amazon and scamming customers amazonI bought two mini samsumg galaxy s3 unlocked international version and the two get blocked by the firm are Telcel and now i lose money

The phone kept shutting itself down after a couple hours of not being used. I looked for this problem online and found a fix on youtube. Supposedly, by scratching the metal on the battery, it would remove a film that improved the connection and allowed the phone to stop shutting down. I tried it and the phone would make it a few extra hours without shutting down, but ultimately, it would shut down again.I thought perhaps that I didn't scratch the film off properly, but alas, before I had a chance to try to fix it once more, the phone was stolen.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant display
Reviews.Author: Syncro
Reviews.Content: My wife has hers with the monthly AT&T; plan, which is very economical and with no contracts. She gets both phone service and data when on the road, however the phone also has Wi-Fi so when at home or near any other hot spot, like at hotels and coffee shops, internet comes directly from the wireless router, and of course is free!What really impressed us was the bright display with true colors, outstanding. The camera also takes great outdoor pictures and video, my only compllaint is that indoor flash pictures are a little weak if not close to the subject. The menus and all apps work well, as in trure Android fashion. Battery life is typical for smart phones, lasts a day or so. This phone is also smaller then the full sized S3, which for us is a plus, easier to carry and fits in a shirt pocket. Like it so much we'll probably get a second one.

The phone is small and lightweight and fits easily into small pockets and such. The camera is way better than any camera on any phone that I have used and seen. The call quality is amazing, and the phone works really well even with very little service.  The battery life could be better, but at the same time the phone charges really quickly. This is a five star phone because it was very easy to use and get to know. The S 3 Mini  is definitely worth the time and money, and it is sure to leave you satisfied. Almost all the major apps like Facebook, Instagram, Skype, Gmail  and Chrome are for free in the app store, so not only can this smartphone be used for calling, but also for social networks and games. This phone never stops giving me pleasant surprises.

It came extremely fast, was packaged perfectly and looked like the box had been opened but nothing was out of place.I have now used it over 2 months in 4 different countries with local SIM cards, and the phone has worked perfectly. I like the S3 Mini over a number of other phones because it is the Samsung build and quality which is great, and because it hass a smaller screen than my own local US phone or other new phones on which the battery lasts a lot less.

Screen size and resolution are great for her too.Icon and font sizes are perfect in their defaults.There are tons of free apps for Android and there is no need to use iTunes to copy music to it either.Personally, I recommend installing Kii keyboard as it offers many styles of input - swipe etc.I also got screen protectors and protective case for it at the same time as she keeps phone in her purse where keys go, etc; to prevent screen and shell damage.EDIT:Battery life is a huge PLUS on this Galaxy!!! After a day use with all the downloads and 'play' with new phone, change went down to remaining 73%!!!I don't get that lucky with my SGS2, even with new battery. Smaller screen size seems to save lots of juice.Other good apps to have:- Adobe reader- Soundhound- ColorNote- Translate- Exchange Rates- Poynt- Lookout- Fast Image Viewer- andLess

Reviews.Title: Nice phone so far, just be aware it's not a US model
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a slightly senile vintage HTC smartphone, and I wanted something that would sync with my Fitbit One. While the Fitbit sync is a bit unpredictable as the phone isn't on Fitbit's "officially supported" list, the phone itself is fine. There isn't a whole lot to say about it apart from that. If you want a Samsung smartphone that runs Android Jellybean, that is a reasonable size, this is a good choice. If you really want the 5" screen, you won't want this as it's closer in size to older smartphones.There are a few things you need to be aware of if you plan to use this phone in the USA or Canada. First, it boots up in German, and it took me a bit of random tapping to find the Locale settings to change it to US-English. As soon as I got that over with, it hooked up just fine with my US carrier after (obviously) moving the SIM card from my old phone to my new one.Another thing is the charger -- it's a European style plug, not US. However, it comes with a regular USB cable, so you can connect it to your computer to charge, or to any 110v or 12v USB charger you happen to have lying around. It also doesn't come with a user manual, although you can find the PDF version by searching the web.Finally, although the phone is unlocked and will work with any GSM carrier, if you're looking for 3G data speeds this phone may not support the 3g channels your network uses. If you must have a 3g compatible phone, buy one from your carrier; if you just need one for voice calls, it will work fine on any GSM network.There's a good selection of "aftermarket" roms and modifications available if you're inclined to root your phone. Obviously this voids your warranty, and it isn't something you should attempt without at least some technical savvy and the awareness that you may "brick" the device or lose settings and data if you mess up.Bottom line: If you're looking for a small, reasonably priced smartphone that doesn't tie you to a specific carrier, this one's a good bet.

Reviews.Title: My perfect little Mini
Reviews.Author: Charlie Brown "CharLesie"
Reviews.Content: I'm not the least bit perturbed by the size. This is how a phone should look, and be. I love my mini, it is perfect for me. Cant get enough of it, and I love showing it off.I just have one problem though. I started using my S3 mini on August 27 and so far, the phone has shut off on me 3 times. The phone would be in my shirt pocket and when I pull it out to check something (because there is no notification light) I realize the phone is off. What's even worse, is that I have to do a battery pull to turn the phone back on. I have pressed the power button for extended periods and it still wont turn on unless I pull the battery: something I expect from a blackberry, NOT my NEW Samsung S3 mini. The battery would be over 70% and it still shuts down. I clear my memory, close my applications, and it still happens. For example, it shut off yesterday AND today.What exactly is the problem? Can it be fixed? Do I need to return it? Please let me know what can or should be done about this shutting off thing because, frankly . . . it is a drawback.Fix that problem, or tell me how to fix it, and I would give this phone 5 stars AND recommend it those who would hear.

Reviews.Author: Ella P.
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful phone in a perfect size, not too big for your pocket or purse, fits comfortably in the hand.  Screen is beautiful, colors are rich, size is perfect.  Works right out of the box. Easy set up, once we figured out how to change the language from French to English.  The small user guide in the box came in French only. The battery charger is for Europe, so the Seller was kind enough to include an adapter for the states.  It came with a separate USB cable too. The speed is good for most apps, and more importantly, call quality is excellent, almost as though you were on a land line.  Samsung put in a 5mp camera, so pictures are okay, just don't expect it to replace your regular camera.  Using this phone on TMobile's network only gives you speeds on Edge, not 4G.  I use it mostly at work or home, where its connected to wifi.  Looking for the perfect phone?  This comes pretty close.

Reviews.Content: great phone.Here are some highlights:- It has a regular size SIM card, therefore no need to cut it. When you travel abroad usually you get a local regular size SIM and save on roaming.- it has a beautiful screen, just the right size. I wish Galaxy S3 had this screen because the one it has is way too big and can't be operated with one hand.- Battery life is impressive, with just the voice and WIFI turned on it managed to run close to 4 (four) days on one charge. You can see that complaining on short battery life is not productive at all since it is not just phone's fault. There are many factors that contribute to short battery life: wireless coverage in the area you live, whether you have all possible social gimmicks turned on that keep draining your battery, running apps in background that are poorly written and waste CPU cycles, amount of time the screen is on and so on.Hope this review is helpful. I am happy with the phone and would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: W. James
Reviews.Content: What with reading comments about some of the delivered phones not being in new conditions, not unlocked and other problems, and not having an U.S. warranty; I was apprehensive of ordering.However, the phone was delivered in two days from Jupiter Mall in a sealed box with the phone protected by cellophane, and including all the proper accoutrements. I plugged in my AT&T; sim card and it worked fine.My previous phone, a Nokia N85 would not act as a "hot spot" for my Kindle 8.9, something I desired.  This Samsung does.I had unlimited data on the Nokia with AT&T.; When I previously changed from a N75 to a N85, my unlimited data transferred with out a notice  from  ATT, who I far as I know, no longer offer unlimited data.  I was hoping it would slip by to the Samsung.  Not to be.  ATT almost immediately emailed me that my new smart phone was not eligible for continued unlimited data and signed me up for 3 GB plan, the smallest I believe they offer.  Oh well, no turning back.On the plus side, the data transfer rate (using speedtest) using my laptop through the phones as hot spots, is four to five times faster with the Samsung.The battery life was not good until I took some advice from some reviewers on dis-enabling some apps (search reviews for info). Also, leaving the wi-fi off when not in use is a big help.All my contacts came across to the Samsung with the sim card.  However, as far as I can find out,the Samsung contact list only allows for a one mobile and email entry, nothing else such as addresses or notes.I pretty much agree with all the positive comments about the phone.And that is all I have to say about that.

Reviews.Title: It's not an iPhone 5 but its not supposed to be
Reviews.Author: James McGuire
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone as a replacement for my 18 year old daughter who's iPhone 4 was stolen. She went back to a feature phone for two months with the big sim before I got the Samsung Galaxy S3 mini. The big AT&T; sim works with the S3 mini so no trip to the AT&T; store. She loves the phone. It's hard to pry it from her hands. The screen resolution is good but not iPhone 4/5 or Galaxy S3/ S4 great. She has all the features you would expect as a front and back facing camera and plenty of storage for apps. She can add extra storage but so far it's not needed. She uses the Pandora app for music and can watch Netflix as well (why would you want to with that 4 inch screen.) She's got all her games and apps. Now here's the great part for parents.When I got my daughter the iPhone 4 I was FORCED to include a data plan with it ($30 extra a month on my bill.)  The Samsung Galaxy S3 mini it seems a data plan is NOT required. AT&T; has not identified this phone as a smart phone and therefore I'm currently not paying for data only 9.99 plus tax for the line a month. AT&T; will automatically identify a smartphone and charge a data plan if you do not have data plan connected to that sim used to activate most smartphones. The Samsung Galaxy S3 Mini is not one of them. When I look at my account at AT&T; wireless my daughters phone is listed as a generic flip phone.So how is she accessing apps? Through wireless. The Galaxy S3 mini can connect to wireless networks like our home.  Starbucks, McDonalds etc does not seem to work for some reason. She can only connect at home. Im not sure why but i bet it's a setting she's not doing properly. So she still uses data at home. Just not cellular wireless data. And I save $30 dollars a month and don't have to monitor her data usage. Only her talk minutes. We have unlimited text messages on our plan.If you have a teenager without a job bugging you for a smartphone and your on AT&T;, get the Samsun Galaxy S3 mini. We've had the phone for 3 weeks now. My new billing cycle starts today so I'll truly know if AT&T; added a prorated data plan but I don't think so. Outside if the home she has no data. I'll update this review if they do.

Reviews.Author: CamShopper
Reviews.Content: Purchased this phone about a month ago and it has worked great! I previously had a Windows 7.5 phone and it just didn't have all the apps I wanted in the Windows marketplace so I tried Android. It has been a huge change but a good one, as I have gone through Apple, Windows, and now Android. This phone is small and compact but has everything the average smartphone user needs. The GHz performance of the phone is slow compared to its big brother the Galaxy SIII, however the jellybean OS really helps. Try to stay away from the live wallpapers and unnecessary apps! The camera isn't the best in low light like most phone cameras, but it does include a handy flash.Overall, it is a great phone for anyone who doesn't like holding a tablet-like phone! It's got everything you need and an expandable memory slot!

Reviews.Title: Don't let the reviews fool you
Reviews.Author: Erdem Demirkan
Reviews.Content: I switched to this phone from My Galaxy S 4G,and i regreted so much. I live in New York City, and network connection frequently drops.Nobody mentioned it, but this phone doesn't have 4G.Even 3G or EDGE is not working properly.My service provider is T-mobile and i never had this problem with my Galaxy S.I used to connect my old phone to my pc and use it as Mass Storage Device..But in order to transfer files between your PC and phone, you have to install Kies which is very bulky.As someone said in the review call quality is very bad.This is definitely an overrated phone.Pros+Bright Screen+Multi tasking+Long Battery LifeCons-couldnt be used as Mass Storage Device-Not 8GB as it s mentioned, it comes with 4,5GB memory-Bad Call quality-MicroSD Card slot is under battery, so you have to remove battery first to get the card-weak 3G signal-Connection Lost+UPDATE+04.22.2013This phone s battery life really amazed me.It takes more than 10-11 hours eventhough i use it for heavy tasks.I think the reason is, it doesnt have 4G, because as far as i know 4G connection is just a battery drainer.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE as fragile as glass
Reviews.Author: Andres Maldonado M
Reviews.Content: Just to warn other customers, I am terrible disappointed in the quality of this phone. It dropped only 2 feet, and all the screen has a big crack on it now. Very surprised with this lack of quality from a Samsung phone. I have own a Captivate and an HTC, and they have been more durable than this.This lack of quality really feels like a joke from Samsung on the customers, paying over $300 for a phone which the screen easily breaks like that? I haven't had the phone more than 2 weeks and now the screen is broken.Reading online, as a weird exception from the other Samsung phones, this one doesn't come with Gorilla Glass. So buyer beware, if you drop this phone THE SCREEN WILL BREAK.Very dissapointed in this phone, don't buy it.

Reviews.Title: Phone broke after one day of gentle handling
Reviews.Author: J. Tyler
Reviews.Content: I purchased my phone online through my wireless carrier. The phone arrived 2 days later. The first thing I notice was how thin and fragile feeling it was, which immediately set up a red flag in my mind. As a result, I paid close attention to how I handled the phone and made plans to get a cover the very next day. I activated the phone and fell in love with it instantly. The next day, I pulled the phone out of my pocket as I walked into the wireless store to buy a cover and found the screen had broken while in my pocket. I had not bumped into anything, I had nothing else in my pocket. Additionally, the pants were not tight, so the phone moved around easily in said pocket. My wireless provider would not work with me on getting the screen fixed (told me my only option was to use my insurance) and at the prodding of some friends, I contacted Samsung directly. They told me a cracked screen voids the warranty so any repairs would be chargable. This burns me for two reason: 1. my carrier has a 15 day love or return it policy, which I now cannot use if I discover this phone doesn't meet my needs b/c the screen is cracked. 2. If any other functionality fails during the original warranty period, I have no rights b/c the screen broke and the warranty is now void. I would LOVE to be writing a glowing review of this phone, but instead I'm left with a bad taste in my mouth regarding this so-called "warranty". I will likely steer as far away from Samsung as possible in the future. I had an LG that fell from a 6 foot high railing onto a concrete patio and the only thing that happened was the battery falling out. This fragile hunk of plastic broke in my pocket. I think I'll stick with LG next time... in the meantime, I get to spend the next 18 months with a phone that makes me angry every time I look at it. It's going to be a long 18 months.

Wat a rip off! !

Reviews.Title: Samsung I8190 S3 Mini Unlocked White Android
Reviews.Author: Santa Candor
Reviews.Content: Just received today, the newest firmware/OS for the 4.1.2 OTA (on my phone directly) as it was updated from Samsung and this is very new at this date of Monday, August 5, 2013 and arrived in my phone's Notification area today. After the upgrade completed, I noticed at once that this phone is lightning fast and the touchscreen is very, very fast and responsive! This is the THIRD update that I received since I purchased this phone in April 2013. Each update is not that large, however, it enhances the performance of this phone. Very encouraged as if the updates keep coming regularly, perhaps4.2.2 will be coming to the S3 Mini. And from my research, it is possible that the S3 Mini may receive the 4.2 OS but it will be a while longer...Till then, I shall keep on trying to update and keep you informed...PROS:- SIZE AND WEIGHT: Perfect size for me as it fits easily into my jeans pocket or smallest purse. And I purchased a leather vertical case that clips to my waistband so I take it with me to the gym to listen to my music or radio when I work out.- STANDARD REGULAR SIZE SIM CARD: The S3 Mini has a regular/standard Sim card slot. (Note the S3 regular phone and S4 phones accept a micro Sim. Good to know as I did not have to cut my Sim card, I just placed it into the S3 Mini and I was good to go, and I did not have to set up the APN settings for Internet and MMS as the setup did this for me automatically). This is good to know if you want to use your regular Sim card and not have to deal with settings yourself. What a great feature.- Phone call clarity etc. - No matter what my location using this phone for phone calls the clarity of calls is loud and clear whether on the phone's speaker, headset etc. I even had to turn down the volume quite a lot as the calls come in so well.- WiFi/3G (Internet): Connects to any WiFi I have tried very quickly and easily. And when not near a WiFi, I use AT&T; for data and easily get 3G and found the data to be very fast, almost as fast as my home WiFi is. (For browser, I installed Opera Mini free from Playstore and found it to be a very easy to use and fast browser).- Overall speed, performance, smoothness, picture quality of the screen--very fast and peppy. And I found a way to SAVE on both memory and on battery. What I did was to go into Apps/ Manage Apps and DISABLED the apps I don't use. Without rooting the phone, you cannot uninstall pre-installed factory apps, but you can disable them. Disabling the ones you don't use makes the phone run faster and frees more memory! Since I am a techie, I know which ones to disable and which ones not to disable, so if in doubt, please ask me in the comments and I will be glad to assist you in this.- BATTERY LIFE: This phone has given me the BEST battery life of ANY smartphone or that I ever owned. And I use 100% brightness. For me, even at 100 brightness, if I use WiFi or Data just when I need it and then turn it off, I get all day into the night on one single charge! (I charge nightly and the phone is at 100% ready to go the next morning).- EXTERNAL SLOT FOR MICRO SD CARD - This helped to sell me on this phone as I can add my personal music, photos, videos and more to this phone!And I placed a 32g in mine for music, files etc. *Keep in mind where External SD cards are concerned: They are JUST for your personal files: music, videos, photos, and other files. When you install apps from Playstore or other sources, they store either in INTERNAL Memory Card or sometimes in the phone area (most store in the INTERNAL SD AREA). This is the law of the land where Android is concerned and ALL newer Android devices (including Samsung) work this way when storing your downloaded apps are concerned.- INTERNAL STORAGE SPACE:This phone is advertised at 8GB of Internal space. The 8GB is the space BEFORE the drive was formatted, OS installed and then factory apps installed. So what I had on the phone BEFORE I installed any apps it had 4.75GB left. This is how it is on any flash drive, SD card, Hard Drive as formatting alone takes up space.Also, since 3.0 Android and above, you cannot save any apps to your personal SD card. Instead the apps are installed one way or the other to the INTERNAL SPACE. However, the good thing is that your personal files as photos, music, videos, and more can be installed to your EXTERNAL SD Card so you do have that space for yourself.**I have a few apps I downloaded from the Playstore, but no games so I still have about 4.08 GB left on my phone for more apps later should I wish to install them.- CAMERA - The 5MP camera concerned me that is UNTIL I took both indoor and outdoor pictures and even video. Well, I was pleasantly surprised. When I printed out some close up and other shots, I was really happy with the detailing in the pictures. And it compared to the picture quality I had with my Samsung Galaxy Note with 8MP camera, so what a happy surprise! Turns out to be a pretty good camera.- Bluetooth Speed and Performance - The Bluetooth paired quickly with several devices and copied files at a great rate of speed.CONS:- Adobe Flash is not supported in this phone or ANY ANDROID DEVICE after 4.0 OS. The only way to get flash is to get a archived flash and use a high end browser such as Puffin or Maxthon Browser. So downloading the older archived flash gives the ability to view SOME internet videos, but this is better than no flash at all. Keep in mind this is a problem with ALL brands of Android devices with 4.0 OS and higher it is just after 4.0 Android came out, the NEW and best flash is NOT supported for Android devices. It is what it is...- Very small instruction "manual" provided with the tablet, however, I went to the Samsung site and downloaded the full manual and saved it in PDF on my laptop for reading anytime I need it. If you want the link for the manual, let you know in the comments and I will give it to you.- This phone will NOT accept an OTG (On the go) USB plug for flash drives, mice, etc. This was not a problem for me, I just plug in the USB Cable to copy files to the phone. So no big deal.-- International Phone so NO US WARRANTY. Not a problem for me because I have learned over time that if a device is going to fail, it usually does it within the first 30 days. This phone has been great--no problems at all!-- No NFC except on the model with the N on the model number. I do not use NFC so I have no problem with that.Bottom line: Would I buy this phone all over again? Yes I certainly would. Will this phone be the best for you? Yes, if you do not expect every bell and whistle feature from the BIG S3, want just the most important features, want a smaller and more lightweight phone that will do all the basic things of a Smartphone, then I totally recommend this phone!Hope this review has assisted you and thank you for reading it. Please feel free to ask me any questions in the comment area and I will answer all questions in a very timely manner.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: De
Reviews.Content: This is my first smartphone.  I researched for a long time and it had to have the following simple, but important features: Small enough to fit in my pocket, camera, video, text, and phone with audible, clear sound. This has all these features and so much more!When I first turned it on it came in a different language, but the easy start up settings allowed me to change the language. I also downloaded the english version of the manual from samsung.com.  Just google it, you'll find it. This smartphone is so easy to use and If you want the battery to last just disable the apps you don't want to use.The camera is my favorite feature.  I recently went on a trip and the pictures and video were awesome. I dare say better than my digitial camera.I also love the calendar widget.  I can enter all my appointments and tasks and it displays on my home page and keeps me on track.I have T-mobile and everyhing synchronized beautifully.  Even the employees at T-Mobile were blown away by my phone. They had never seen the mini and they thought is was so cute.Anyway, if you're looking for something easy to use, this is it.  I'm not a techy guru so I guess if you need fancier features then buy a huge brick phone, but I think this does just about everything a person needs. The only downside is that since its not sold in the U.S. a warranty is not provided and T-Mobile won't insure it. Why it's not sold in the U.S. is beyond me.  I also bought my phone from Delta Mobiles and I didn't have any problems.

The display of the regular S3 is better, but this phone more than meets my needs as a not-compulsive cell phone user. I mainly text and send email, occasionally use navigation and sometimes use the data like if I need store hours or to find an ATM. First thing was to change the language as my phone was international - but it was a breeze. It read my T-Mo SIM card with no problems, synced up my contacts via gmail and them synched up my bookmarks via chrome and danngggg I was on my way to being a Samsung fan.

Reviews.Content: So when I decided I was done with Blackberry I wanted a phone that was around the same size as my BB9700.  This is PERFECT. Reviews.Title: Samsung SIII Mini Defective Unit
Reviews.Author: R. Ortega "R. Ortega"
Reviews.Content: I have an SIII cell phone for over 3 years. I'm very satisfied with it.Based on this I bought an SIII Mini cell phone for my daughter by Nov.2013. It was supposed to be "new".When it arrived, I found that the camera was not working at all. The firmware update feature could never be done because "the system has been modified"... not by me... When I dug the Internet looking for the meaning of this message, I found that this phone most likely had been rooted and that modification was blocking the normal update procedure.Additionally, this cell phone has damaged 3 batteries in a row. I am sure it has a problem in the charging circuits.I have contacted the Samsung Service in my country and they explained to me that there are certain online sellers that ship used, refurbished or simply rejected products. That seems to be this case.In summary: Samsung makes great cell phones, but in this case I was unlucky to buy this SIII Mini from a very bad seller.Very disappointed with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Bad Defected Products...
Reviews.Author: Deepak Gupta
Reviews.Content: This is the 1st time I am giving a review about anything online, as this time I was forced to write one. I was looking for a good cell to gift my sister and looking at the reviews, I felt good about this cell and bought it. Little did I know that the product would be bad. I very happily gifted it to my sister as a birthday gift and to my dismay and utter shock, just after 3 months her battery got swollen up and bad and stopped working. I don't know, whether it's the sellers malfunctioning or the Samsung company's, but I have never heard or seen a battery getting bad in just 2-3 months rather than 2-3 years and it is highly embarrassing for me to face my sister. Friends, beware of buying such expensive products from here as the the quality is very bad. I highly doubt and feel the products are duplicate or defective pieces.

Right now they became much cheaper and available for $185-200 which is even better... I was thinking to switch and upgrade to S4 mini which now cost almost what I paid for S3 mini last year but then decided not to go for it... I just got used to this model and happy with all the features it is offering... you also have to keep in mind that S3 mini using standard SIM card while S4 mini is using microSIM card (which can be obtained from service provider for small fee... that's not a big deal)...The only negative thing is that it's battery last from morning till evening with average use and phone has to be charged every night... I guess the regular S3 model has higher battery capacity but it is also bigger in size. And size of this S3 mini is what attracted me to this phone model on the first place...

Reviews.Title: fraudulent seller
Reviews.Author: tammie lea bidwell
Reviews.Content: I bought a Samsung Galaxy III off amazon. 369$ in December 2013. The phone arrived looking brand new with case and charger. When I took it to get activated, it did not have a SIMs card. upon further inspection, it did not have a serial number or the inside sticker and I was told it was probably stolen. Attempted to contact the seller, No response. I thought I was out the money, but luckily Amazon backed me and refunded the money. Be careful who you buy from..........FYI  the phone was available elsewhere for cheaper had I done a little shopping around....lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: High speed does not work with Lyca(t-mobile mvno)
Reviews.Author: NM
Reviews.Content: This phone does not provide a high speed data connection on the lyca network(t-mobile mvno) despite the fact that it does support the hspa 1900 frequency which is what t-mo supposedly provides 4g service on in refarmed areas. I am in Dallas which is a refarmed area. So either the phone sucks or t-mo sucks or both. I've seen a few reviews where the authors have tested this on the t-mo network and state that high speed works. These are the lucky ones, obviously I am not. Buyer beware.4/27 Edit: I am not in a t-mobile refarmed area so this phone cannot provide me high speed on the 1900 band. That said, I am dropping my review to 1 star. This phone has more dropped calls and zero bars than our 19 buck BLU Zoey. We have returned it.

Reviews.Title: i BOUGHT A MINI SAMSUM S3 AT AMAZON- IT FAILED, NOW SAMSUM SAID THAT IT IS A FAKE.. HOW CAN IT BE
Reviews.Author: Karol P.
Reviews.Content: A YEAR AGO A BOUGHT MY SECOND SAMSUM MINI S3 BACK IN VENEZUELA, IT STARTED TO HAVE PROBLEM RECENTLY, I WENT TO SAMSUM COMPANY TO GET HELP, AND THEY SAID THAT MY PHONE IS A FAKE, IT MEANS THAT THEY CAN NOT HELP ME TO REPAIR IT BECAUSE IT IS NOT AN ORIGINAL SAMSUM TELEPHONE, SO THEY RECOMENDED ME TO GO TO SOME OTHER PLACE.  HOW CAN IT BE POSSIBLE? I TRUSTED AMAZON TO GET MY PRODUCT.. HOW CAN I REQUEST AN EXPLANATION FROM SELLER? WHAT SHOULD I DO TO GET MY PHONE REPAIRED.. I PAID FOR A SAMSUM, NOT FOR A FAKE COPY.. I NEED HELP TO SOLVE THIS AOUT I HAVE THE BOX AND THE INVOICE AND IT SAID THAT IT IS A SAMSUM, BUT NOW IT IS NOT.

Reviews.Title: Works Perfectly in Rwanda
Reviews.Author: Kayla Britt
Reviews.Content: I'm a Peace Corps Volunteer serving in Rwanda, and I wanted to find a smart phone to make it easier to keep in touch with family and friends. I was looking for something reliable, sturdy, unlocked, and useable in the U.S. (at least with some carriers) and in Rwanda...and that's exactly what I got!  Shipping was faster than expected. I was very happy to find it was brand-new, and came in a sealed box. The box said it was for use in Nordic countries, and all of the instructions were in Nordic languages, but that wasn't a problem because it is very user friendly. I charged it overnight (the charger worked in the local outlets), put in my SIM card (MTN Rwanda), and it has worked perfectly ever since! The phone is beautiful, has a crystal clear screen, and it meets all of my needs! However, I would suggest that you also get a case with a little grip. The phone by itself is very smooth and slippery!It was a lot cheaper to buy a Samsung phone online rather than buy it in Rwanda. It's also a lot better quality than the local brands that are shipped in from China. If you are living abroad, and you are looking to order a reliable phone, this is the one!The box came with:-Phone-Battery-Headphones-USB computer connection cord-Charger

Reviews.Title: Good Phone
Reviews.Author: Jerry McConkey
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have ever had a smart phone. I like it. It's easy to use. It seems to me, however, that the phone part is is the minimum part of it. I like the possibility of using all the communication apps as I learn about them, but in order to do it I feel like I have to put my whole life on public display. The gaming apps really don't interest me. You'll understand, I'm a third age adult. It seems to me that Samsung would have done well not to make all the pre-installed apps (particularly the gaming ones) permanent and irremovable seeing that many older working people really only want what they would use on their app screen. The great majority of the apps are just advertisements.They should all be optional.However, they didn't ask me.Having said that, I'm super happy with the combination of services that you use to have shipments arrive on time. Super good!

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "narniaworld"

I wished I can buy one for my husband and two children - but when we have $$, I would like to.  I subscribe to H2O Wireless Pay-per-minute plan.  $100 for 2000 minutes and I still have $30 worth left before I need to recharge.  I use Wi-Fi capability to chat using KaKaoTalk app with family and friends.  Only when it's necessary I text or call.  I hardly use my Nook for reading as I can use the Playbook app to read my e-books.  Though small, the screen is very sharp and crisp.  Love it!!

Reviews.Title: Minor problems, but great phone
Reviews.Author: OverCsShopper
Reviews.Content: I ordered this phone to be used in Peru on the Claro network. Some friends brought it with them when they visited me. It worked immediately with the existing SIM card and plan that I already had. I have loved having an Android (I was coming from years with a Blackberry). This phone takes great photos and even took a nicer nighttime shot than a friend's iPhone last night. My biggest complaint is what you'll see on various online reviews of this phone: sometimes it refuses to charge and I have to shut it off and then plug it in for it to charge properly. This will happen for a day or two and then it will suddenly decide that it can be charged while turned on for a week or so. There doesn't seem to be any rhyme or reason to the issue. The AC charging cord that it came with was surprisingly cheap-looking, but it charges with the myriad of Blackberry cords that I have from past phones so that wasn't a big deal. I plan to use this phone in the US while visiting later this year, so I will try to update my review at that time regarding how it functions there.

At least it was "reset" and no data from the prior user was still on the phone. The battery showed 57% charge when inserted.  So far it seems to operate well, as if it were a new phone. Came with a USA charger. It is a nice size and has a nice feel.5 stars for the phone 1 star for the vendor, so I give it 3.

Reviews.Title: Not what was described in the detail
Reviews.Author: Lianne G.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone because I had had a Samsung previously and really liked using Android phones, the only problem with my prevoius phone was the fact that it had too little RAM (200mb) and kept freezing and rebooting.My brother has exactly the same model and is very happy with it, so I thought I would get the same one.The phone its self is great, however the particular one that I received from Cellular Distributors, did not have the advertised 1GB RAM, it only had 500MB. It also turned off randomly, which I'm assuing is from the lack of RAM as it required almost 450MB of the 500MB to run without any apps open.In addition there were 3 instances in less than a 1 month that I had it, that an error message appeared, randomly, and the phone became non responsive and needed to have the battery taken out in order to reboot it.Just to summorise, this is a really good phone and my brother has really enjoyed it with non of the above problems, however I believe my phone was a dud and did not meet the specifications as per the sellers details.I will purchase this phone again, but not through this seller.

Reviews.Title: Fast shipping - phone wouldn't charge - delayed refund
Reviews.Author: Shem Bernache
Reviews.Content: I received this phone via quick shipping - was excited to get it after work. I called my phone company to have number switched over powered phone on and plugged it in and went to bed. The next morning, the phone was powered off. Once i got it powered on, it showed only about a 70% charge. I didn't think much about it, and went to work. Phone worked fine, but that night plugged it in and again it shut off during the night. I tried emailing seller with slow response, and finally found number off Google and called the seller and they sent me a new battery and charger. Again, fast shipment - but didn't solve problem -plus once batteries died completely they would not charge, rendering my phone useless and locking all my data/info on phone :( Called them again and they offered replacement or refund. I took refund and ran. Mailed phone with delivery confirmation and receipt but even though I had record they received the phone, it was still several days after the "normal refund time" before I contacted seller again by phone to get response of "our refund department has been down, but it will go through today." Finally got money back the next day....

Reviews.Title: Nice phone, camera but turns off while charging
Reviews.Author: srm
Reviews.Content: Great looking phone. Great call quality. 5MP camera takes great picture.One problem is that the phone turns off while charging/after charging. First I thought that after the charge is full, the phone turns off for some reason. So, I tried turning off the energy savings feature but that did not make any difference. Later noticed that the phone even turns off when the charge is not even full like at 70% full. This is a problem because I have missed a few reminders due to phone turning off by itself while charging. I may also miss some important calls. Until I find a solution to this problem, I am giving the phone a 3 star rating.

Also it doesnt have led lights so I have to consistantly check my phone to se if I have a new eail or text messages. Reviews.Title: Cell Phone Unlocked
Reviews.Author: Mariano
Reviews.Content: I previosuly had a Samsung Galaxy S Advance so I was familiar with the android OS and expectations.This iphone is faster than S Advance but smaller in screen size.I did notice some lags when switching applications, but I believe is the nature of an open OS such as Android in comparison with the Iphone OS which is closed it runs smoother.One concern I have is that when I leave it plugged in ,at night, to recharge the battery . I set the alarm and it doesnt work its like its turned off.I didnt have this problem with the other phone so I am not sure what is the cause. If I dont have to leave it plugged in or what.In other respects its great that the phone is unlocked I use it in Argentina without issues, and I plan to use it on the USA when I go there as well.I do thinks its a reasonable price for the features it brings. All in all I am sattisfied with the product.

Reviews.Title: Sumsung USA warranty does not cover international pnones models GT-I8190
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: Be aware of this phone model GT-I8190 is an international model number so if the phone brakes Samsung USA is not going to repair or replace the phone for you.  If the phone brakes during the first three months, you can return it to amazon but if brakes after 3 months you have to report the problem to Samsung and they are not going to fix the issue for you.  In summary,  Amazon should not allow re-seller to sell international phones to US customer!!!Sumsung USA warranty does not cover international pnones models GT-I8190

Reviews.Title: Phone not packaged for US user.
Reviews.Author: S Rudolph Reyes
Reviews.Content: There were several problems with the phone package as I received it: both the Quick Start Guide and the phone itself were in Romanian and the charger is for European outlets. I logged into the US support site for Samsung to download the Guide and the User Manual and found out that this phone is not supported by the US site. As I was not familiar with the phone, I thought of sending it back but then tried the UK Samsung site and was able to download the manuals in English. As I was unable to located a European-to-US adapter locally, I ordered one online. When I received it and plugged in the charger, I found out it did not work. I do not want to have to charge my phone through a computer all the time so I managed to find a charger with a US plug that works. Had I been warned that this phone is not intended for the US market but with a little work can be corrected, I would have given it a four-star rating because it would have been my choice to put in the extra effort. Had it been packaged for the US market and everything worked, I would have given it a five-star rating because for my needs, this is a perfect phone.

BATTERY AND CHARGER WERE NOT ORIGINAL. Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy S II Mini + Straight Talk Unlimited
Reviews.Author: TheRussianSpy
Reviews.Content: I have bought this phone to use with Straight Talk. It was mostly a positive experience.I bought a SIM card through Straight Talk website (ATT-card, not Tmobile one), installed it, activated it (again, through website) and I was ready to make calls.One issue that I came across and why I'm taking away one star. At first I didn't have 3G connectivity (only E). Hours with Straight Talk shoot-me-in-the-face-customer-support didn't help. Restarting the phone, entering and re-entering all the settings - nothing got it to work. If you are having the same issues:-go to settings>more settings>mobile networks>network mode-switch to GSM or WCDMA (not auto) (it will ask you if you want to turn off data to do it, say ok)-switch back to Auto mode-if that doesn't change your data to 3G or H do it a few more times.After a couple weeks the problem may return - you will be stuck with E (EDGE). All I can do is to keep following the same procedure.Other than that the phone is great. Tons of apps on google play, amazing screen contrast and resolution, perfect size, and since it's not the top model anymore - affordable price. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: Charging problems and other issues
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: I had to return this phone: big disappointment since I love its size, interface, and speed. Two days after I received the phone, the wall charger stopped charging. The charger that came with the phone was cheap looking and the micro USB was already slightly loose before it stopped charging. I tried several wall chargers, but these phones expect some fairly specific chargers. After several attempts, I succeeded in getting it charged using an iphone wall charging block and a Samsung  Galaxy Note 10.1 charger. Then more charging problems appeared: the battery would not fully charge even letting it charge overnight night (it would reach 86-87% maximum); the phone would discharge rapidly with modest use (email reading, a couple of phone calls/text messages) even with power saving mode on and terminating applications often. Final problem: as I heard that upgrading to firmware 1.4.2 may help with the charging issues, I tried to update it using Kies. Kies would not even recognize it as a Samsung phone. I tried various versions of Kies, with no success. It seems like this phone cannot be upgraded in the US unless you do in an unofficial way. At the end I gave up: too many issues; I could not trust this phone to last any reasonable length of time.

Reviews.Title: Main Review
Reviews.Author: Alfredo Baldassarre
Reviews.Content: Pros:Very light for its size, isn't too big-3.5G is pretty fast (Btw the power saver feature can throttle your bandwidth aka internet "speed" apart from the processor)-Android 4.1 preloaded-Still has the good multitasking feature on GS3-(Call Quality) So I tested its battery life with voice calls. On one occasion, I had a 1 hour long call and it battery was down from 100% to 90%. So that equates to probably a 10 hr continuous talktime with a full charge. Very clear speaker-Touching/Pointing is accurate-Sensitive screenNeutral¯¯¯¯¯¯-Battery Life (expected it to be better, still pretty decent though)-Screen resolution (Though the resolution isn't high, pixelation isn't obvious from viewing distance. Its not grainy and still very clear-Direct Call isn't always responsive. I think the camera doesn't see your ear always while you're messaging or in the contact list. It might take 1-2 more tries.-Screen contrast & brightness - Excellent indoors, good outdoors (without direct sun). Could have done better under direct sunlightCons¯¯¯¯-Actual Free internal memory is about 4.5GB.-Minijack is a little soft with the volume.-You can't put your apps on the SD card without rooting it.. Firmware limitation on Samsung's side most probably :(-There is no LED notification blinker light like on the big brother Galaxy S3 (on the left of the front speaker). You have to wake up the screen to check if you've received messages

Reviews.Title: basic review
Reviews.Author: YA
Reviews.Content: Phone is indeed unlocked, and I had no problems with any of the european and american sim cards.  There are many language options 58 of them actually;I mention this because someone had written a review saying they did not have english as a language choice and there is a instruction manual in english and french that came with the phone.  The actual charger outlet plug is a GB outlet but it came with a american charger adapter, also there was a usb cable included(phone can be charged this way also). There is a standard sim card slot NOT micro.  Phone also came with headphones. There is also a micro SD slot.The phone is very easy to use and the size is just right the mini size is ABOUT the size of a iphone, the non-mini is quite too lage for me. I can just throw this phone in my pocket without it being bulky. I have used this phone for about 2 months now.  U can view movies and play games of course but the battery goes quite fast so it needs to be charged daily. Even with just standard use (phone calls and text only) it can only go 2 days without charging.The flashlight and calender functions is my favorite.  The camera is good but it does have a tendency to blurr. This phone does work with US carriers and european but u must buy a sim card from them, its cheaper to go to walmart/bestbuy and buy a sim card. Overall it is quite practical.This phone will not work in Japan to call calls/text (fyi) since they have their own network all together.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy S3 mini
Reviews.Author: kkirk
Reviews.Content: I love this phone. What I don't love is all the sellers that list them as unlocked or able to use on any GSM network. It took me buying and returning 3 phones and a lot of researching on the internet on my fourth one to be able to use multimedia services. But if you are lucky enough to get one that is truly fully functional then you will love not having a mini tablet in your pocket. It doesn't have all the functions of the full size S3 like S Beam but I don't do all that stuff with my phones anyway. It still has lots of cool features.

Reviews.Content: IS THE BEST PHONE THAT MAY EXIST.ANDROID IS A VERY COMPLETE- it has a beautiful screen, just the right size. I wish Galaxy S3 had this screen because the one it has is way too big and can't be operated with one hand.- Battery life is impressive, with just the voice and WIFI turned on it managed to run close to 4 (four) days on one charge. You can see that complaining on short battery life is not productive at all since it is not just phone's fault.

Reviews.Title: S3 Mini
Reviews.Author: shell
Reviews.Content: I bought the Blue one of these, but it's the same phone so I'm posting my review here as well...I've heard a lot of back and forth reviews on this. I love this phone. I live in the U.S. and i have consumer cellular as my phone provider. I bought this phone, stuck my sim card in it, and had no trouble at all setting it up. All i had to do was go through initial set up steps like language settings (it was in English (ireland) and i changed it to english (united states)). Connected to our WIFI and the WIFI at my work without any problems...this phone amazes me with what it can do in a phone that's not overly bulky. My brother got one of these as well and i set it up exactly like mine without a single problem.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone at a really good price
Reviews.Author: Ameer Ali
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a reliable smartphone and don't mind not having the latest versions of products, this phone may be for you. So far I have had no major problems with this item, I even dropped it more than a couple times and the screen was not damaged. It has a nice size and isn't bulky looking.  A lot of apps that cost money in the Apple Store is available for free via the Play Store...once you do not mind adverts in it. So far it is proving to be a good phone at good price, much less than Iphones or the S4.

Reviews.Title: Cute and easy to use but battery sucks
Reviews.Author: Helga Patricia Vieira
Reviews.Content: I'm new to android...still have my iPhone too though... :PStill getting to know the little guy but so far I like it. The seller is great, fast shipping and unlocked item just as described.Coming back 6 months later to change my review...yest, it is a good phone with a lot of functionalities but the battery life is horrible. 100% at 7AM, fast forward 7 hours and about 4 or 5 60-second phone calls later and the battery is at 50%. Seriously, I talk on the phone for less than 10 minutes and my battery life is 50% gone? And no, I don't have any other apps open in the background so this is something Samsung needs to work on. Changed from 5 stars to 3 stars because in 12 hours the phone dies because the battery is so bad. And here I thought the iPhone battery was bad...

Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: Love this phone.  I didn't want to get the big brother Galaxy S III so I waited for the mini to arrive and I wanted an unlocked version so I can take it with me when I got deployed to Afghanistan.  I have been playing with this phone and it does everything my wife's Galaxy S III does except the NFC but other than that this is a great phone.  I use T-Mobile pay as you go so I get both text and data and I'm not constrained to a monthly plan like everyone else.  If you don't want a monthly plan get an unlock phone and a sim card so you can do the pay as you go plan vs monthly payment plan.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: D. Gilbert
Reviews.Content: Shipping: Ordered Sunday, Shipped out on Tuesday, Arrived on Saturday.Setup: All I did was pop off the back, stick my T-Mobile sim card in, added the battery and it was at 50% charge. Pretty easy to setup by just following the prompts. If you are familiar with Android and Smartphones, it will take 3-5 minutes. If that.Phone: The phone (at least for me) is from Orange (France) and so most things were setup in French and European. You'll also get an European charger that came with an American adapter to get into the wall. I usually use the micro usb though so it's not a problem now that i have two of those now plus the wall charger.Overall: This phone feels kinda cheap but looks cool. It was super easy to set up and you can hardly tell it's "mini." Actually nothing about it really screams mini. It's just a smaller phone with some downgraded features for 50% less than the bigger version.

Reviews.Title: oooooooh shiny!
Reviews.Author: Fujiyama Mama
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I ever bought an "unlocked" phone.  Essentially, I always got the subsidy phone (i.e. free/cheapy phone) whenever I renewed my contact with Tmobile.  However, since they've scrapped their subsidies, I figured it was time to branch out a bit.I was torn between the Galaxy S3, and the new Nokia Lumia. Was honestly leaning more toward the Nokia, but my friend has been having nothing but trouble with her Nokia (different model, to be fair) so I erred on the side of caution.I bought from one of the independent sellers and figured I was totally safe since I already knew this model was compatible with my carrier.  WELL, no one told me about "international" phones, so imagine my shock when I opened up the box and EVERYTHING was in French. (next time do MORE research before purchasing.  Lesson learned!)Charged her up (thank GOD it's USB, because wall charger was European), and turned it on. After fumbling around for a bit, finally set the language to English.After that, everything is great! The OS runs super fast (or maybe it just seems that way since my last phone was the G2 (google phone)), and navigating a website in Firefox no longer makes me want to smash my head into walls.  Video runs smooth, and I hardly ever have streaming issues (especially on wifi).Speaking of videos, the picture is amazing, and for scale, the screen is almost the exact size of a credit card.  Lightweight, palm sized, and let's face it... it's cute as hell!When I first showed this phone off to my friend, her exact words were:  "That's not a Samsung Galaxy.  It's too damn small!"  Apparently the mini isn't well known?  (or maybe just not in the States?  I have no idea..)My only gripes are minimal:1) being a European phone, apparently there's something about the device itself that makes it so you cannot disable the shutter sound when you take pics (even if you have an app to do so).  Bummer.  No more taking covert pics of drunks on the bus.  (It's pretty loud, too).2) The display does not have 4G.  After doing some research on this, learned that for whatever reason, 4G is displayed as "H" (to mean "high speed"?)  But when the "H" is up, it is, in fact, running on 4G.3) Sometimes there are inexplicable signal drops.  Not sure why this is happening, was never an issue with the ol' G2.Anyhoo, hope this helps if you're thinking about it.

Reviews.Title: Truly amazing device
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my purchase. I saw the normal galaxy s3 as being too big for me. I am 6'3'' and have rather large hands, however the normal S3 is simply TOO large to carry in my pockets. This S3 mini is perfect. I travel internationally and having an unlocked phone is a true necesity. You can buy a prepaid SIM or buy a SIM and add minutes pretty much anywhere you go. This device allows me to do that. The camera and overall functionality is amazing.I used to have a Galaxy Inception ("S1") and the screen broke. To fix it, on average, it was about $300 (plus or minus $50 depending on venue). This was a "no brainer" purchase. Highly recommend this samsung s3 mini.

This was the discription of the phone.  I am not technical so in looking at the following description of the phone I would not have seen this problem.It was not until I went into the Returns area from World Wide that you see the description about their cell phones and returning itemsThey needed to put this on the item page"Cell Phones may only be returned within the first 30 days from the receipt of shipment.Buyers are responsible for network, GSM band, and Carrier compatibility, including internet browsing (2G, 3G, and 4G), picture and text messaging functionality, which are not guaranteed.GSM phones are not compatible with any CDMA based carriers such as Verizon, Sprint, Alltel, Cellular One, Metro PCS, and Cricket. Please confirm your carrier runs on a GSM network before purchase."GSM 850/900/1800/1900; HSDPA 900/1900/2100 Super AMOLED capacitive> touchscreen 4.0-Inch> 5 MP Primary Camera, autofocus, LED flash, Video 720p@30fps, Secondary> VGA camera OS Android OS, v4.1 (Jelly Bean), CPU Dual-core 1 GHz,> Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n, DLNA, Wi-Fi Direct, Wi-Fi hotspot, Bluetooth> v4.0 with A2DP, LE, EDR 8GB Internal memory; 1 GB RAM; microSD Memory> card slot; Standard battery, Li-Ion 1500 mAh>> The GALAXY S3 mini runs Android 4.1 (Jelly Bean)with a 4.0 display> while maintaining the familiar Galaxy S3 design. The Galaxy S3 Mini is> powered by NovaThor U8420 Dual-core 1 GHz CPU with 1GB of RAM and a> 5MP camera that does 720p HD videos. The Galaxy S3 Mini is full of> graphical capabilities, fast screen transitions, and an upgraded> Google Now service featuring contextual search. Over at the front,> there's a VGA camera for conference calls. The 4.0 display is of Super> AMOLED variety and pushes 800×480 resolution.

Reviews.Title: Horrible. DO NOT PURCHASE
Reviews.Author: R. Smith "Beckay"
Reviews.Content: I am writing this from a college student point of view.I have been using unlocked smartphones from amazing for about 4 years now. The phones that I have purchased have all been spectacular except this one. I ordered it because my broke and I needed a new one. So since the reviews and everything was "oh so good" I decided, why not? I waited for about 4 days and finally my phone came. Now if you're a college student you understand how important it is to have a phone. Especially when you need to contact mom and dad. Anyway, so I got the phone and as I looked on the side the box said "new." I opened the box and there was white stuff all over the screen! Luckily that was just on the screen protector so I took the protector off and plugged in the phone to charge it. The phone would not turn on. I drove about 30 minutes to a verizon store to see what they could do and if I could get a SIM card but the lady said that this phone is not made for verizon even though it is listed in amazon as capable for verizon. The. She went on to tell me how I should get my money back ASAP because the phone was broken and that's why it was not turning on. Returned the phone. Now waiting to get my money back to try and get a different phone. Also I am giving this 1 star because amazon is making me give it a star. I would give it no stars if aloud.

Reviews.Title: Awesome form factor
Reviews.Author: rpv
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful and lightweight alternative to its bigger cousins. I used for sometime and I could not find anything wrong. Obviously if you play racing car games or Temple Run Brave, one can notice a little slowness, it is absolutely great for normal uses of navigation, running, as a music player, as a twitter client etc.The S3 Mini comes with a 4-inch Super AMOLED WVGA resolution display (800x480 pixels). It is called mini, but few years ago this probably is a mega. While less pixel factors than the 4.8-inch Galaxy S3, the Mini has 233  ppi where S3 has 305.96 ppi, the Mini's screen resolution is still well within range for a 4-inch screen. Memory can be increased easily and in a very cheap way with a microSD card. Card slot microSD, up to 32 GB.Highly recommend. I am looking for when S4 mini comes in!

Reviews.Title: Beware!!! Amazon False advertisement!
Reviews.Author: Cloud
Reviews.Content: If you are buying this from Amazon and looking for NFC variant, be sure to choose the specific Seller that specifically says that they carry the NFC version. Although the Amazon product technical specs will say it has NFC but not all seller sells the NFC version. They are pretty much the same price but I'm one of the unlucky ones that just click on the first available seller and gotten the non-NFC version. Grrrr... Not very happy about that because I specifically picked this phone because of the NFC capability technical specs on Amazon... And this is a phone for my wife. I have the S3 (it's bigger brother) and the NFC feature would have allow us to transfer and share media with much eased.PROS: The phone has great power for its small size. As a gear head for high tech devices, for this price I would have chosen the better performance of the Nexus 4 but this phone is not for me. This is for my wife (not too concern with performance) and she wants a smaller phone. She wants the best performance phone at a much smaller size. So... S3 mini is the best bet (without resorting to the iPhone). Although this phone carries a no name CPU, this phone out of the box this phone will score around 3000 on quadrant which is beats the performance of many full size phones (such as the galaxy nexus, Galaxy S2,LG optimus 2X, etc). One thing Amazon forgot to mentioned is it's awesome gorilla glass which make the screen scratch resistant. That is definitely a very nice feature to have. Speakers are also very load for its size and battery life is awesome.CONS: It comes with Touchwiz and I'm not a Touchwiz fan but you can download your own launcher. The storage space is also small. Althought it is 8GB, it is only around 4GB usable space so don't look to install a lot of apps and games. This phone is for my wife and she is mostly concern with pictures and music. Pictures, music, and non-app files can be stored on micro SD card so this 4GB internal storage is plenty of room for her. If you want to install a lot of apps and games, consider the 16GB version.Looks very similar to S3. Performance is not at par with the regular S3 but it's very impressive for a small phone. I would have given 5 stars if not for the False advertisement. To send it in will cost me extra money and extra hassle so I'm just stuck with the non-NFCphone.
